comments:
I've been trying to use the VE to create a Shell that has another Shell in the
same source file as its parent.  I encountered an error after manually setting
the parent of the sShell1 to sShell.  Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce this
anymore, but the problem did go away after I'd removed the parent parm from the
new on sShell1. One thing that is still happening here is that the location of
the sShell on the graph view goes far down to the right when the sShell1 has
sShell set to be the parent and sShell1 (though correctly shown as a child of
sShell in the JB view) isn't shown on the canvas.

Here's a (possibly related) stacktrace I noticed after seeing this error:

A basic version of the code I was using looks like this:

	private void createSShell() {
		sShell = new Shell();
		createComposite();

		createComposite1();

		createComposite2();

		sShell.setText("Survey Appclient");
		sShell.setSize(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point(800,400));
		sShell.setLayout(null);
		sShell.setSize(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point(693, 419));
		
		createSShell1();
        }

	private void createSShell1() {
		sShell1 = new Shell(sShell,SWT.APPLICATION_MODAL | SWT.DIALOG_TRIM);
		createComposite3();
		sShell1.setText("Choose a Username");
		sShell1.setSize(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point(285,123));
	}

As a workaround... it's not necessary to set the parent of the secondary shell
(sShell1). Just construct it with the style bits to emulate a dialog look.
Otherwise the VE will try to model this second Shell as a child of the first
Shell which will cause many problems.

I'm not sure we can do anything in the short term to prevent this particular
problem when you set the first shell as the parent of the second shell.

Dialog (Shell) parent is important for painting a dialong in front of its parent
shell.

While the second Shell (the dialog one) is being process first in the remote VM,
one of it's parameters is the first Shell. Since this hasn't been allocated yet,
it attempts to do so and wipes over the global expression in the
ConnectionHandler. This causes the bytes to be misread and an invalid command to
be interpreted.
This has been released to HEAD.

In addition to Rich's fix, I added a popup dialog (Change Parent...) for a Shell.
This brings up a list of other Shell's on the canvas that can be selected and
updates the first argument of the ctor of the Shell with the new reference Shell.
Or you can select <none> from the list to set it with no parent.
R1.0.2 has been released. Moving to Verified state.
R1.0.2 has been released. Moving to closed state.
